title: [K-12] UDL and CCSS-Integrated Instructional Design: Elementary Social Studies Project-Based Learning Development

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of elementary education curriculum, understanding of social studies content, and experience with Project-Based Learning (PBL)
context.additional_context: Strengthening project design capabilities for social studies aligned with CCSS (Common Core State Standards) using the UDL (Universal Design for Learning) framework for pre-service elementary teachers.

learning_goals: Development of a Social Studies Project Design Applying the Three UDL Principles (Engagement, Representation, Action/Expression)

Learners can create a team-based assessment rubric within 2â€“4 weeks, referencing the CCSS (Common Core State Standards) for reading, writing, and critical thinking. The rubric must include three evaluation criteria (e.g., text comprehension, logical organization, evidence provision) and meet at least two of the three teacher verification checklist items: clarity, validity, and practicality.

Learners can produce customer service scenario materials using Padlet and Google Classroom, incorporating at least three digital expression methods (text, images, videos), and achieve an "excellent" rating in at least four out of five peer evaluation rubric items.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
